msItem.author: Josephus
Pseudo-Hegesippus
msItem.title: De excidio Iudeorum
msItem.rubric: fol. 4ra Incipiunt quinque Libri Hęgęsippi nationę iudęi. dę excidio iudęorum. Incipit prologus.

msItem.incipit: Quatuor libros ręgnorum quos scriptura complexa est sacra˷
Bello parthico quod inter machabeos duces gentemque medorum diuturnum˷
msItem.explicit: fol. 161va opes autem eorum appositus ab apsis prius ignis consumpsit est
msItem.finalRubric: Egesippi Hystorię Liber quintus Explicit De ęxidio Iudęorum.

supportDesc.foliation: Foliated in nineteenth-century ink, accurately but only in part; later foliated in modern pencil, which counts the flyleaves and skips a page after fol. 153 (153bis): fol. 159 in the original numeration becomes fol. 161.

collation.signatures: Gatherings are numbered in the text hand ink at the centre of the foot of the last page, .i. to .xix.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in drypoint; pricked on outer edges of page only, for frame and individual lines. Horizontal rules on fol. 5r occur, from top to bottom, at 36.5 | 50.5 | 248 | 263 | 329 mm; vertical rules from left to right, 20 | 88 | 95 | 102 | 170.5 | 218.5 mm. Lines spaced 6.5 mm apart.

handDesc.handNote: Directions to the rubricator in a fine charter hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Each book opens with large, intricately decorated Arabesque capitals: fol. 4ra, prologue, Q in blue with blue, green, and golden decoration; fol. 4va, book 1, blue and golden B decorated with blue, red, green, and golden foliage sprouting from the mouths of deer; fol. 51va, book 2, blue and red S with blue, red, and green decoration; fol. 71vb, book 3, golden E with green and blue decoration; fol. 94ra, book 4, green E with red and blue decoration; fol. 114vb, book 5, red and green A with green decoration. The first letter of each new chapter is enlarged, in red.

additions.p: On cover, Egesippus (s. xvi); fol. 2r, Hegesippus de excidio Iudæorum (s. xvi); fol. 4r, Egesuppus de excidio Iudeorum (s. xvi).
Pressmarks: 23 (spine); MS. Jesus Coll. Ox. C. 63 (spine, blue label); 1 Arch. 3-2 (spine, fol. 1v); 2060-41, 41 (23) (fol. 2r).

binding.p: Romanesque, whittawed leather over oak boards with a chamifered edge; recovered, reusing fragments of original leather. Extended tab over endband.
binding.decoNote: On spine, De excidio Iudeorum (s. xiv?).

history.origin: Written at Cirencester Abbey between 1149 and 1176. On fol. 3ra, written in a slightly later script than the text hand, Liber sancte Marie De Cirecestr’. D’ Andree Abbatis secundi tempore scriptus per manum Radulphi de pulleham scriptoris D’ Adam de lamora tunc Cantore.
history.acquisition: Appears in the list of the books of John Prise in the 1602 donation willed to Jesus College by his son Gregory Prise (1535–1600). Neil R. Ker, ‘Sir John Prise’, The Library, 5th ser., 10, no. 1 (March 1955): 1–24.

listBibl.bibl: Andrew G. Watson, Catalogue of Dated and Datable Manuscripts c. 435–1600 in Oxford Libraries (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1984), no. 800 and pl. 59.
